headline: Vacations won't be priority for low-end travelers in 2026: Analyst
summary: A record 31 million Americans are expected to take to the skies and travel this week for Thanksgiving, according to Airlines for America's data, as major airline operators recover from the US government shutdown. Bloomberg Intelligence senior aerospace defense and airlines industry analyst George Ferguson discusses travel trends for this holiday season, commenting on his survey that illustrated lower enthusiasm for vacations in 2026. Also catch George Ferguson weigh in on whether the US government shutdown could impact airlines' earnings for this quarter. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Vacations won't be priority for low-end travelers in 2026: Analyst
content.description:
A record 31 million Americans are expected to take to the skies and travel this week for Thanksgiving, according to Airlines for America's data, as major airline operators recover from the US government shutdown.

Bloomberg Intelligence senior aerospace defense and airlines industry analyst George Ferguson discusses travel trends for this holiday season, commenting on his survey that illustrated lower enthusiasm for vacations in 2026.

Also catch George Ferguson weigh in on whether the US government shutdown could impact airlines' earnings for this quarter.
